outputs.output_descr:
The main objective of the project between UNDP and the Ministry of Housing and the Environment, is to assist in the formulation of the National Implementation Plan (NIP) through the analysis of current sources, existing stocks and use of Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) as well as legislative and institutional arrangements for chemical management in order to develop sustained capacity to fulfill Trinidad and Tobago's obligations and reporting requirements under the Stockholm Convention. 

Proposed outcomes of the project include:
1) A strengthened National Co-orginating Committee to promote and supervise the formulation of the NIP.
2) Preliminary inventory of unintentional POPs sources and loads.
3) An updated inventory and strtegy to manage and dispose of POPs stockpiles in a safe, efficient, economically viable and environmentally sound manner.
4) Options and strategies to strengthen laboratory capacity to monitor POPs environmental pollution and to assess risks for particular vulnerable human populations and ecosystems.
5) Plan to develop and/or strengthen the legislation to support the safe aznd sound management of hazardous chemicals and wastes, as well as the implementation of the Stockholm Convention provisions.
6) Practical and economically viable strategy to prevent and reduce POPs releases to the environment and potential sources of exposure to vulnerable populations and ecosystems.
7) Strategy to strengthen POPs and hazardoous waste management infrastructure.
8) Public awareness and social participation strategy to prevent or reduce the risks of POPs and other hazardous chemicals and wastes.National Profile of the Infrastructure for the Environmentally Sound Management of Hazardous Chemicals and Wastes.
9) National Implementation Plan consistent with the Global Environment facility  (GEF) Initial Guidelines for Enabling Activities for the Stockholm Convention on POPs.
